meanings.definition: The action of investing money that has been previously invested.
meanings.sent1: After selling his stocks, John decided to make a reinvestment in a new company.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was due to the wise reinvestment of their profits.
meanings.sent3: The reinvestment in the failing business turned out to be a smart move.
meanings.sent4: Her reinvestment in education paid off with a better job.
meanings.sent5: The reinvestment in the community center improved its facilities greatly.

meanings.definition: The act of putting money back into a business or project in order to generate more income.
meanings.sent1: The reinvestment in the bakery led to increased sales.
meanings.sent2: The reinvestment of funds into research and development boosted innovation.
meanings.sent3: His reinvestment in the lemonade stand made it the most popular in town.
meanings.sent4: The reinvestment in marketing strategies resulted in a higher customer base.
meanings.sent5: The reinvestment in the farm equipment improved productivity significantly.

meanings.definition: The process of using profits or dividends to purchase additional shares or securities.
meanings.sent1: The reinvestment of dividends allowed for further growth of the portfolio.
meanings.sent2: Her reinvestment strategy involved buying more shares in successful companies.
meanings.sent3: The reinvestment in stocks proved to be a lucrative decision.
meanings.sent4: Reinvestment in bonds can provide a steady income stream.
meanings.sent5: The reinvestment in real estate brought in substantial returns over time.
